content: I use these apps on an ARMv7 Cortex-A9 hardware - Rockchip RK3066. Devs, please confirm if all the binaries in this app are compiled with VFPv3 and NEON SIMD optimizations enabled. For the most part it runs fine @ 1280x720@60Hz. However, I can see slowdowns sometimes. Esp. with Yamagi Quake 2.
replyContent: Hi, they are disabled by default because unfortunately some devices do not have these instructions. However I suspect the issue isn't CPU but maybe the very old Mali-400 GPU. If you email me I can send you a test APK with them enabled so we can test if it makes any difference!

content: Outstanding! Gold standard on Android. Thanks Dev.

Much like Delta Touch, Quad Touch is a fine way of playing the Quake series, and even Hexen 2 for crying out loud, on the go, and the touch controls even work nicely with the fast gameplay. I will say it is a bit more tedious to set up, but that's due to how the file structure is for each game. Other than that, it's pretty great.

Anything comes from Emile (Beloko, OTG) is pure Gold! If you want to play legendary Quake games on your android, then grab this masterpiece! Like it's brother Delta, Quad gives its users tons of customizations and modifications to create & chose, with better optimization & features! With masterclass support from developer himself and constant updates & fixes, this is another greatest app created for Android history! Emile is a blessing for Android community, truly!

Excellent work from Beloko (and gang?) as always! Can play Q1/2/3 just fine with music and keyboard/pad support. Even Hexen 2 finally works in this very well! The best software out there in running these games! Crossing fingers still for ROTT engine/support ;)!

The gameplay is smooth once you get everything up and running, this is a great app, found a bug though, i recently bought a bluetooth keyboard and mouse and when i tried to change the movement controls in both quake 1 source ports, some of the options werent selectable, everytime i pressed the down arrow it would skip over some options and wouldnt let me change them to a more comfortable control scheme. Other than that, ive had no issues with this app and would highly reccomend it to anyone.

I'm impressed. It runs like charm. Lots of settings and customization. I just can't get the controls right. Any possibility for the classic controls? So I wouldn't have to aim up and down. It's really hard to aim with touch controls. Other than that, it's perfect. UPDATE: sv_aim 0 does what I wanted to achieve! Excellent!
replyContent: Hi, you can reduce the 'look' sensitivity to zero to stop looking up/down. However in Quake you kind of need mouse look because it does not auto aim vertically so I think it would be impossible to complete if you couldn't. However just reducing the sensitivity a lot will help with control.

content: how do install the quake 1 mission packs?
replyContent: Hi, Just copy the mission pack folder in to the Q1 folder (where id1 is) and they will show up on the main screen.

content: This app is a friggin revelation! Having recently bought a clip to attach my phone to my ps4 controller, I started to look for things I could play with it. I've been a fan of the Quake series since the first one released, but the thought never even occurred that I'd be playing them on my phone! This app runs 1, 2, 3 and Hexen 2, along with their expansions, brilliantly! All you need is the data files and you're good to go! I've been having a blast playing these classics again!
Worth paying üòÅ

This is the best way to play the quake series on Android. Ignore people saying "where's the game", or "it doesn't work", as they don't know how to use the app, you need to provide the files from the full, legal, paid version of Quake (1, 2, or 3) before you can play. Once you do that, this has the best controls for an FPS on mobile other than the other app by these devs for Doom. Got this up and running on my old Note 4. Works great with my 8bitdo SN30 Pro controller. It comes with every source port you'll ever need, and it has run pretty much every mod I've thrown at it. However the sound is a little choppy in Quakespasm when using HDMI out, most likely down to my old hardware, so your mileage will vary. Long story short, if you want Quake on the go, look no further.

This port collection is amazing - the persistent gamepad configuration is the best part.  The implementation of Quake 3 controls for mobile is also remarkable.  I had a hard time figuring out how to run quake 1 map packs, so I thought I'd share here to potentially help others.  The way I found to do it is to just copy the arguments from the map pack's README into the 'Extra Arguments' area when running the game.
Absolutely Amazing! I hooked up my Xbox One controller using a mountI purchased on Amazon, and this has turned my phone into a 1st Person BEAST!

Great stuff, but the UI on Quake 2 is tiny with seemingly no way to make it larger. I can't read the HUD! Yamagi Quake 2 improves this but the aiming is... inconsistent in it, and the frame rate far worse. Everything else good though.
replyContent: Unfortunately Quake 2 original had no way of resizing the menu, this is a direct port. Try the GLES3 render for Yamagi, it was faster on my devices. Not sure about the aiming, whats wrong with it? Thanks

replyContent: OK now try pressing the 'cog' icon next to the engine icon and press 'DELETE CFG FILE'. Or try deleting the folder "Quad/H2/.hexen2" (this folder is hidden). If that does not work try copying over your PAK files again, or get another source (corrupt?). I say this because it definitely works on the S9 :) Email support@opentouchgaming.com

content: great app

From the creators of Q2 Touch comes an app that supports a myriad of Quake versions designed for Android. This app does not include any actual game data from the games it has support for, but rather an interface to allow for playing the games on your Android phone. Provided you own and know how to transfer the game data files from PC to Android, this app is definitely worth the purchase. Also includes Quake 1 Darkplaces support, which is essentially Quake 1 remastered for the 21st century.
Hexen 2 sealed the deal for me. Making blood pacts with Satan on the go! üëπ
Thank you for making it so easy to use these source ports on android! Really hope you release a Doom 3 port, that video from a few years ago looked promising!
Awesome App can play q2 deathmatch on phone perfectly. touch controls setup great!
the perfect touch version. many options, several different engines, perfect controls.

I am able to play quake multiplayer while riding in the car. Portable quake finally! I had a great Death Match today and I am glad people are still devoted to this game. It is great especially with the lighting effects. It makes multiplayer even more enjoyable. You did a wonderful job!
I couldn't help myself so I got this..... so do I load in all the files or just th paks
replyContent: For quake just the PAK files, for Hexen 2 copy all the files.

content: Played some more after getting the time to sit down and experiment with mouse and keyboard. I use a Bluetooth board and 2.4 wireless mouse through USB C adapter. As of this writing I'm more amazed than I was before! Absolutely perfect and super smooth engine port with FULL MOUSE AND KEYBOARD SUPPORT ON ANDROID 8.0+, running on a SnapDragon 630 so you don't need the highest grade phone to run it. So incredibly happy with this. Gonna try an USB C to HDMI for display later. Absolutely Phenominal!
replyContent: Great, thanks for updating the review, glad it's working!

content: Note: I've only tested the Quake I engines, but Im pretty impressed with this. The inclusion of multiple game engines ensures a custom tailored experience to whatever phone you've got.

I was bummed when QI4A didn't work, and ftedroid didn't either. when i saw this and realized that it was made by the same guys who made Delta Touch, i just knew i had to get it. Somehow, they made the controls work on mobile, which was my only complaint with the q4a series. mod support is top notch (because it is just the pc source ports but on android), and the picks for the source ports are the cream of the crop (fteqw still has its splitscreen!). You'd be losing money by not picking this up!
i love it.

So perfect; a big thanks to the developers. Specually on being able to run the music; though quake spasm has no music, the DarkPlaces engine runs it perfectly - amazing job OpenTouch. Have an amazing day !
simply awesome!! id give 6 if I could, thanks devs for that quick response, quake 15 mod up and running!!
replyContent: Hi, the latest version should fix Quake 1.5, let me know if it now works OK!

content: This is an another excellent batch of source ports from Open Touch Gaming - a real joy to play Quake, Quake 2, Quake 3, Open Arena and Hexen 2 and perhaps a massive slew of mods on your phone - or if you're like me, you fancy a controller and are probably using an Nvidia Shield.  It's fantastic but I can't give it a 5 star as it stands for several reasons. One is performance in Quake 3 and Open Arena, it's not great as QIII4A beats Quad Touch in this aspect and two is in Hexen 2, pressing the B button on my controller turns me into a sheep... Every single time despite the fact this is relegated to an item in the game, that needs serious fixing asap, it's frustrating. 3 is that it feels unfinished, despite the touch menus being taken straight from Delta Touch, the weapon wheel function isn't working right, custom inputs are keys that can't be remapped within the games leaving you with messages like salute, taunt and wave in Quake 2, thus leaving you unable to rebind their functions in the options menu of the game, it's still rough.  While what's already here is really fantastic and I'm glad I paid for it, I'm hoping to see updates that fix these issues fast, it's still a beta.
replyContent: Hi, yes there are a few thing to fix sorry! Weapon wheel is fixed in the next release. I am interested to know how you got your gamepad B to turn you in to a sheep?! Can you email me with details please? Thank you

content: oh I'm in love

Similar to the excellent Delta Touch, Quad Touch lets your android phone run all the Quake games from Quake 1-3, and even Hexen 2. The source ports used here are familiar if you have used them on PC and run as such. Doing advanced bunny hopping on touch screen is a bit diffcult, though. Highly recommended if you want Quake-on-the-go!

Just what you'd expect from the creators of Delta Touch. This app does not disappoint. Runs great, plays well with touchscreen and has gamepad support. Vanilla ports for Quake 1 and 2 with Darkplaces and Yagami if you want a nice visual upgrade
Amazing application. The definitive and only way to play Quake-based games on Android devices, and in general the best First Person Shooter experience available for Android. Don't miss it!
I owned the previous apps this developer released and was more than happy to pay again for their work. An awesome app for playing the pc classic quake series on your phone. Well worth the price.

The second-to-none engine to run these classics on your phone. It runs smoothly, flawlessly. I even installed an unofficial expansion for Quake II which isn't listed in the game menus ('Zaero'), and it too just worked with no hassle. Buy this now and support the dev so he can bring the rest of his ports back to Play! You will not be disappointed.
an excellent upgrade to quake touch! loads many more quake games than previously and the quality is amazing)

Simply fantastic! As with Delta Touch, Quad Touch is a collection of the wuale source ports all in one location. I.E. a way to play all of the classic quake games right from your pocket! Full controller support and active community makes this one a breeze and a no brainer for the price. Between the mods and community made projects, there is a near endless stream of content. Definitely check this and Delta Touch out. Best way to play the classics. Period.
Woohoo, finally a mobile Quake port that supports Arcane Dimensions!  Gamepad support is stellar also.
Fantastic emulation work. Dev deserves high praise for bringing the classic Quake experience to Android.
this is the best quake 1-3 source port
